Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: First electronic general-purpose computer = ENIAC
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Faster decisions using a computer and mathmatics

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: John von Neumann creates a merge sort algorithm, in which the first and second halves of an array are each sorted recursively and then merged
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Arrays allow mathmatics, grouping and sorting of data

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: The first computer hard disk used
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Storing data for reuse = reduces time to recreate data from scratch from programming

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: The modem invented
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Communication between computers, foundation of the internet, sending / receiving data

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: Statistician John Tukey defined data analysis
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Defined the process and procedures of collecting data for analysis without being a statistian

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: Dr. E.F. Codd creates concept of "normalizing data", relational models and foundation to storing data in databases
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Made data independent from specific software / coding langauges and created framework for storing and retrieving data using rows (tuples), columns and tables (entities)

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: FORTRAN Programing Language supports comma seperated value (csv) file formats
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Programing Language can input / output data files with consistent results

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: Bloomberg Terminal Introduced
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Financial Data Analysis of Bond Market to market makers without being a programmer

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: Edward Tufty writes the book "The Visual Display of Quantitative Information "
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Defines ways to communicate with data beyond tables and numbers

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: SQL Language Standardized across all database technologies
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: A common language agnostic to technology for storing vasts amounts of data in a centralized location

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: Microsoft Excel
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Mainstream productivity software available to anyone in business world

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: The term “BI (Business Intelligence)” was proposed by Howard Dresner at Gartner in 1989
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Data becomes as Asset = used for analysis to make decisions from

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: On-Line Analytical Processing (OLAP) and Business Intelligence become industry standards
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Data Volumes Increase, specialized software and skills required to answer questons from data

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: Guido van Rossum creates the Python programming language
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Programming language that has versility beyond specific usage like back end processing or front end User Interface (UI)

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: Finnish engineer Linus Torvalds introduces the Linux operating system. Price: $0.
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Open Source software and Programming Languages become available to anyone without costs

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: Bill Inmon writes "Building the data warehouse"
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Organize data in a way to gain insights and answer business questions

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: QlikView software created
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Distruptive Technology that removes barriers from answering questions using data but creating software that does everything in one place = ingest data, etl, data visual

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: Ralph Kimball writes "The data warehouse toolkit"
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Enables growth of the data analyst and business intelligence professional = understand requirements to ground swell data marts

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: XML Created
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: The goals of XML emphasize simplicity, generality, and usability across the Internet.

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: The journal Data Mining and Knowledge Discovery is launched; the reversal of the order of the two terms in its title reflecting the ascendance of “data mining” as the more popular way to designate “extracting information from large databases.”
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Evolving Data Mining as a skill moving away from specific technologies needed to answer questions without specfic expertise in 1 technology

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: Carlo Strozzi introduced the concept of NoSQL and non-relational databases
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Removed defined structures required by Relational Databases to store values by key-value and catalist for Big Data solutions like Google BigTable, Amzaon DynamoDB and Graph Databases (social networks)

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: REST / APIs
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Data Democracy = If i can use a browser, I can access data without the need to batch process

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: Natural Language Toolkit
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: statistical natural language processing (NLP) for English written in the Python programming language

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: JSON was first presented to the world at the JSON.org website in 2001
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Evolved from XML, data agnostic to the programing langauge that created it

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: Stephen Few publishes Information Dashboard Design: The Effective Visual Communication of Data
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Evolves data viz as a skill and effective means of communication. New careers in Business Intelligence and Data Visualization

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: facebook
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: The Social Network influences people and data are communicating

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: Google Analytics
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: A web search engine and metadata (data about the data) become a product that businesses will pay to use

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: Apache Hadoop Big Data Storage Created
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: The Data Lake offers alternatives to data marts and traditional data warehouses.

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: NumPy Library Introduced
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Python language library grows beyond programing to data analysis tool

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: Twitter
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Unstructured Big Data offers opportunities for analysis of data beyond traditional limits. The need for Data Scientists becomes a career aspiration

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: Amazon Web Services (AWS) S3 storage and introduced its Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2)
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Cloud computing = boundries to physical computers is removed. Information technology (IT) segments into specialized fields

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: GitHub
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Version control and sharing of code between teams, departments and industries become easier and fasters

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: Apple iPhone
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Mobile Analytics becomes an industry

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: pandas is a software library created
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Python evolves to the tool for open source data analysis

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: Uber Founded
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Using Data and Technology to disrupt the transportation industry

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: Kaggle.com created
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Data Democracy in action = reward ANYONE who can solve problems using data and algorthems

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: Naomi Robbins founds the Data Visualization New York Meetup
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Pioneering Woman Engineer and Data Visualization expert who runs the largest offline community of data visualization professionals in the world

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: Creation of the Raspberry PI
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Making the IOT (Internet of Things) mass scale of data with a device that costs only $25

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: Alberto Cairo publishes the "The Functional Art: An introduction to information graphics and visualization (Voices That Matter)"
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Charts become an artform and careers like data journalism become mainstream

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: Project Jupyter
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Open Source code and libraries becomes an all in one tool that's easier to use

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: Amazon Alexa Ecosystem
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Making voice to data mainstream and allowing API integration by other vendors

Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Milestone_Event: The Data Literacy Project launches
Evolution_of_Data_Milestone.Why_Important: Building a data driven culture where anyone can read, work with, analze and argue with data
